intro: Xanthorrhoea thorntonii, commonly known as the Blackboy Grass Tree, is an endemic species of Western Australia. It is a hardy, fire-resistant plant with a distinctive tall, narrow trunk and a crown of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces a unique, urn-shaped inflorescence that contains small, white or cream-colored flowers. Xanthorrhoea thorntonii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with deep root systems that allow it to survive in poor soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various native animals.
